entries.description: Mark Miller, a veteran financial journalist and author, talks about his new book "Retirement Reboot: Commonsense Financial Strategies to Get Back on Track."

entries.title: How to Save—Not Cut—Social Security
entries.description: Social security needs to be saved not cut. A veteran financial journalist explains why and how.

entries.title: 'AGT: All-Stars' Week 3 Results: Who Got a Golden Buzzer and Who Left?
entries.description: Simon Cowell gave out his Golden Buzzer on the third week of "America's Got Talent: All-Stars", sending the act straight to the grand finale.

entries.title: Dad Dies While Trying to Save Family's Dogs and 8 Puppies From Burning Home
entries.description: Khanh Van Duong, 56, went back into the house to save the dogs once his wife and daughter were safe.

entries.title: 'The Mandalorian' Season 3 Trailer, Release Date, Cast, Plot and More
entries.description: The first trailer for "The Mandalorian" Season 3 was revealed on Monday, January 16 which teased Din Djarin's next steps with Grogu.

entries.title: Internet Obsessed With French Bulldog Drinking Out of a Straw: 'Influencer'
entries.description: "I need a tutorial on how to train this trick," commented one TikTok user.

entries.title: Russian Forces Advancing Towards Bakhmut After Capturing Soledar—ISW
entries.description: A spokesman for Ukraine's eastern military command, Serhiy Cherevatyi, has reiterated however that Ukraine's forces were holding out in Soledar.

entries.title: Photo of Stray Cat That Looks Like 'Museum Exhibit' Baffles Internet
entries.description: The Wisconsin-based photographer told Newsweek that he texted his wife, "I have award-winning shots, no joke," after capturing the image at nighttime.

entries.title: Donald Trump's Rape Remarks in E. Jean Carroll Deposition—Read in Full
entries.description: The former president is being sued by the former Elle columnist for remarks he made while denying the alleged assault in the 1990s took place.

entries.title: Russia Has Lost More Troops Than The U.S. in WWI, Ukrainian Figures Suggest
entries.description: The Kremlin's incursion into Ukraine has become the most costly conflict for Russia since World War II, while the number of Ukrainian casualties may be as high as 100,000.

entries.title: Bryan Kohberger Evidence Not Fully Convincing— Scott Peterson Attorney
entries.description: The case against Bryan Kohberger is "pretty strong," but hinges on circumstantial evidence, according to Lara Yeretsian.

entries.title: Kari Lake Might Have Finally Given up Her Hopes of Becoming Governor
entries.description: The Arizona Republican could run for Kyrsten Sinema's Senate seat if her court case over the gubernatorial result is unsuccessful, according to a CNN reporter.

entries.title: Wordle Today #577 Hints, Tips and Answer for Tuesday, January 17 Game
entries.description: Newsweek has some hints and tips to help you solve today's "Wordle" puzzle.

entries.title: 'Mass Chaos' as Shooting at MLK Day Event Sees Eight Gunned Down: Police
entries.description: At least eight people were shot, while two others were "trampled" by a panicked crowd as shots rang out during an MLK Jr. Day celebration in Florida on Monday.

entries.title: Get the Latest Super Bowl Odds for the Eight Remaining Teams After NFL Wild-Card Round
entries.description: The Super Bowl 57 odds heading into the divisional round of the 2023 NFL playoffs continue to favor the Kansas City Chiefs and Buffalo Bills.

entries.title: Failed GOP Candidate Accused in Dem Shooting Plot Claimed 'Rigged' Election
entries.description: Solomon Peña was arrested in connection to shootings at the homes and offices of New Mexico Democrats after losing in a landslide to a Democrat in November.

entries.title: Trump Lashes Out at 'Disloyalty' of Unsupportive Evangelical Leaders
entries.description: The same group that likely sent Trump to the White House in 2016 now seems reluctant to back him publicly.

entries.title: Trump Dismisses COVID-19 Vax Safety Claims, Says He Saved 100 Million Lives
entries.description: Trump suggested that he saved 100 million by pushing the development of the vaccines, arguing that some were calling it "the greatest thing that ever happened."
